ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 168
ygData.msgSnippet: ... if ... Thank you Drokk, I will walk around them today.  I just was not sure if I could go to far up on the hill.  But the way folks where talking if I go
ygData.messageBody:
> Message: 2
> Date: Thu, 11 Nov 1999 15:59:04 +0100
> From: andreas.mangs@...
> Subject: Re: Digest Number 167
>
> When you see the raiders in the distance, walk inlands and around them and
> then back down to the coast.
> Or get a invisibility to pass them.
> Or get a teleport by a druid to east karana, see to it that you are invis
if
> you are KOS by the druids.
>
> Drokk, lvl 41 shaman
>
Thank you Drokk, I will walk around them today. I just was not sure if I
could
go to far up on the hill. But the way folks where talking if I go from the
cost line
I would be killed as soon as something saw me. Fresh Meat I guess.

Thank you Drokk again for all the help may your skills always be at their
fullest.

> Message: 3

> You can easily get to East Karana by hugging the coast and then simply go
> around the raiders and then back to the coast. Just run along the high
ridge
> near the raiders and then when you are past - get back to the water.
>
> To be even safer. Stop at the Wizard Spires at the first stone bridge and
> get either a sow or Invisibility or even both.
>

So that is what that thing near the bridge is :) Thank you so much Wizaro
Wrathcaster. I will do that also on the way down.

Thank you again Wizaro Wrathcaster may your mana always be be full

> Message: 4
> Date: Thu, 11 Nov 1999 09:27:03 -0900
> From: Brian Pifer <bpifer@...>
> Subject: RE: Digest Number 167
>
> Doesn't look like anyone told you where Milea is. When you make it to
East
> K, head east across the zone until you get to a Valley. This is the same
> valley that leads to High Pass. I am pretty sure the north south loc is
> zero. You can also follow the path from the bridge, just go towards High
> Pass. When you get to the entrance, Almost everyone will take the path
> going up. You need the one that is level, or down. She is near the very
> end. you will have to run a long way, maybe 10 min, down that valley to
get
> to her.
>
Thank you *kneels to him* you have been a great help to his poor lost
warrior.


> As for getting past the raiders, you can also try passing them by swimming
> under water or during the rain. The rain will lower the distance that
they
> can see.
>
Wow never thought of going in the water or waiting for Rain. I just thought
Rain was a pain for me to see in. What a great idea :)

Thank you so much Brian and good hunting to you always.



Thank you all for all your help good hunting to each and every one of you.

Rose / Ranala the Crying Warrior of Qyenos of Prexus Server
